definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: He liked to take his time over breakfast .
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢从从容容地吃早饭。

sentences.english: Let's sit down. Take your time and tell me all about it.
sentences.chinese: 咱们坐下来，你从从容容给我讲讲全都情况。

sentences.english: We have ample time for a leisurely lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我们有足够的时间从从容容吃顿午饭。

sentences.english: People never know to get away from them gracefully .
sentences.chinese: 人们素来不知道怎样从从容容地离去。

sentences.english: Through this low-lit mistiness Tess walked leisurely along.
sentences.chinese: 苔丝就在这样光线暗淡的暮霭里，往前从从容容地走。

sentences.english: You may read the newspaper at your leisure.
sentences.chinese: 你尽可从从容容地看报。

sentences.english: You'll relax, take it easy, watch the Young and Restless. '
sentences.chinese: 你可以放松，从从容容，看护孩子和不安的人。

definition: neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
leisurely and free (idiom); carefree and at ease
